docs.snippet: Programs like San Diego State and Baylor have become havens for those disillusioned by their experiences at larger ports of entry to the N.B.A....
docs.lead_paragraph: Programs like San Diego State and Baylor have become havens for those disillusioned by their experiences at larger ports of entry to the N.B.A.
docs.abstract: College basketball programs like that at Baylor, which is led by four Division I transfers and will meet Wisconsin in NCAA tournament, have become havens for those disillusioned by their experiences at larger ports of entry to the NBA; Second School Club, once a small group flying an invisible red flag, has grown into a popular movement carrying no stigma.

headline.main: Players Reach Biggest Stage in Their Second Act
headline.print_headline: Reaching Biggest Stage of Their Careers in a Second Act

docs.abstract: Wisconsin defeats Baylor, 69-52, in Round of 16 of NCAA tournament.

docs.abstract: Dayton outpaces Stanford, 82-72, in the Round of 16, to advance to the program’s first regional final in the NCAA tournament in 30 years.

headline.main: Tourney Returns to Garden, but 1961 Won’t Be Back

docs.snippet: A ruling that Northwestern football players had won the right to be considered university employees is not only about money, some college basketball players said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A ruling that Northwestern football players had won the right to be considered university employees is not only about money, some college basketball players said.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column; ruling that Northwestern football players have won the right to be considered university employees could forever change the landscape of college sports; ruling, if upheld, would allow players to form a union, to win more rights and protections--perhaps even paychecks--in return for their contributions to the business of college sports; NCAA is likely to fight ruling if it is not overturned.

headline.main: For College Players, Gaining Rights Amid Guarded Words
